key_risks: Regulatory and legal issues, including significant fines and employment discrimination cases
Cybersecurity vulnerabilities, with recent data breaches affecting sensitive financial data
ESG-related legal challenges, including antitrust lawsuits from Republican-led states
Market and operational risks due to reliance on global financial markets and competition
controversies: $115 million criminal fine for defrauding clients by overcharging expenses
$4.2 million settlement in an employment discrimination case
Antitrust lawsuits over ESG initiatives from 11 Republican-led states
environmental_issues: Legal challenges related to ESG initiatives and climate activism
social_issues: Employment discrimination cases raising concerns about workplace practices
governance_issues: Regulatory penalties highlighting compliance risks and reputational damage
Leadership changes introducing execution risks during transition

sources.title: State Street Corporation to Pay $115 Million Criminal Penalty and Enter ...
sources.snippet: BOSTON - Massachusetts-based global financial services company State Street Corporation entered into a deferred prosecution agreement and agreed to pay a $115 million criminal penalty to resolve charges that it engaged in a scheme to defraud a number of the bank's clients by secretly overcharging for expenses related to the bank's custody of client assets.
